Getting started using CMake

This guide assumes that your chai3d installation is located in your home folder (e.g. ~/chai3d)

Prerequisites

  • Make sure that CMake is installed for your platform.
  • On Windows, make sure that one of the following compilers is installed:
    • Microsoft VisualStudio (2013 Community Edition is recommended)
    • MinGW (mingw-w64 is required for both 32-bit and 64-bit builds)
  • On Linux, make sure that the following development libraries are installed on your system:
    • GLUT
    • libusb-1.0
    • libasound2
  • On Mac OS X, make sure that XCode and the XCode Command Line Tools are installed.

Installation

  • (optional) On Linux, install the drivers and device management permissions for the following hardware:
    • Force Dimension (see ~/chai3d/external/DHD/doc/linux/readme.txt)
    • Sixense (see ~/chai3d/external/sixense/doc/linux/readme.txt)
    • 3DSystems (see ~/chai3d/extras/hdPhantom/doc/linux/readme.txt)

Compilation

  • open a terminal (or a DOS prompt on Windows)
  • cd to ~/chai3d
  • create and cd to an out-of-source build folder (e.g. ~/chai3d/build):
    mkdir build
    cd build
  • configure project file:
    cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release ..
  • (alternative configuration) to configure project files with debug information, run:
    cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Debug ..
  • (alternative toolchain) to configure project files with a different toolchain (e.g. MinGW on Windows), run:
    cmake -G "MinGW Makefiles" -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release ..
  • build project as configured:
    cmake --build .

Trying the examples

  • from the terminal:
    • cd to ~/chai3d/bin
    • run examples (e.g. ./01-mydevice)
  • from the file manager:
    • navigate to ~/chai3d/bin
    • double-click on example executable (e.g. 01-mydevice or 01-mydevice.exe)

Reading the documentation

  • check out the documentation page
